intro: Gymnema flavum, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Indian spinach, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its stinging hairs on the leaves, which can cause a mild irritation upon contact. The plant is often cultivated for its edible leaves, which are used in traditional cuisines and herbal remedies. Gymnema flavum typically grows in moist, shaded areas and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in greenish-white clusters.
